result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew T Stoiber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $570.87 to the Citgo Gas Station - to be paid to Probation as a Condition of Probation. (w/surcharges)

Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Court finds that if the Defendant successfully completes probation and has no new criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the Defendant's interest to have this expunged and society will not be harmed and grant expunction.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random urine screens.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED. To be used at the Agent's discretion, as well as to huber/straight time.
Perform 75 hours as a Condition of Probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew T Stoiber

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated

Notice of Court Ordered Financial Obligations Status

  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Andrew T Stoiber in court with attorney Andrew Walter.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
-  6 months jail straight time STAYED for 1 year Probation
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $570.87 to be paid to Citgo Gas Station to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.   Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No contact with Citgo Gas Station. 
- Defendant to perform 75 hours of community service as a Condition of Probation.
- 30 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours)  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. 

Defense requests expunction.
State takes no position for expunction. 
Court orders if defendant has no new law violations and successfully completes probation that it is in the interest of the defendant and society will not be harmed and will
grant expunction.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Andrew T Stoiber in court with attorney Andrew Walter.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a date for plea/sentencing in 30 days. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Andrew T Stoiber in court with attorney Andrew Walter.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Walter is waiting for an offer on this matter and requests another date. Court grants request. Defense to advise Court on the next date if this matter will be set for a plea or trial.  Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Andrew T Stoiber in court with attorney Andrew Walter.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 3, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Andrew T Stoiber in court with attorney Reisha Mitchell for J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Andrew T Stoiber in court.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
